final_answer.precision_note: Current (1.50 A) and time (30.0 min) are 3 s.f. Result limited to 3 significant figures.

method: Calculate charge passed: Q = I * t. Convert time to seconds: 30.0 min * 60 = 1800 s. Q = 1.50 * 1800 = 2700 C. Calculate moles of electrons: n(e-) = Q / F = 2700 / 96500 = 0.027979 mol. From the half-equation Cu2+ + 2e- -> Cu, 2 moles of electrons deposit 1 mole of copper. Moles of Cu = n(e-) / 2 = 0.027979 / 2 = 0.013990 mol. Calculate mass of copper: mass = moles * Ar = 0.013990 * 63.55 = 0.889 g.
checks: Stoichiometry of electrons to metal used
